title: Johnny O'Connor (baseball)
text: John Charles O'Connor (December 1, 1891 – May 30, 1982) was a <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">Major League Baseball</a> player. Nicknamed "Bucky", he played one game at <a href="catcher">catcher</a> for the <a href="Chicago%20Cubs">Chicago Cubs</a> on September 16, 1916. O'Connor replaced the Cubs' <a href="Rowdy%20Elliott">Rowdy Elliott</a> after he "split" his finger on a foul tip. The Cubs' other catchers, <a href="Jimmy%20Archer">Jimmy Archer</a> and <a href="Art%20Wilson">Art Wilson</a>, were themselves injured. O'Connor caught one inning until Wilson, who had been sitting in the <a href="grandstand">grandstand</a>, then "limped" to the Cubs' <a href="Changing%20room">clubhouse</a> to put on his uniform, replaced O'Connor and finished the game.
